result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic J Pape was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge

--To pay $50 summons fees

--To pay drug surcharge if applicable
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent

--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--No possession or consumption of alcohol

--No contact with known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent

--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent

--Random drug and/or alcohol screening

--To submit DNA Sample as directed by Agent

Court finds that society will not be harmed and Mr. Pape will benefit and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation, under 973.015

Arresting Agency: UW Whitewater PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent

timeConds.notes:

Sentence may transfer to Rusk County as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:23 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dominic J Pape in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) a misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; for purposes of employment and alcohol and other drug treatment and to commence 6/13/16 by 6:00 pm  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To pay $50 summons fees
--To pay $25 drug testing fee
--To pay drug surcharge if applicable
--To submit DNA Sample as directed by Agent
--No contact with known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
Sentence may transfer to Rusk County as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Court finds that society will not be harmed and Mr. Pape will benefit and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation, under 973.015
Recess: 9:44 am

[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]

Atty De La Rosa: Thought had resolution, but not quite ready today. Request matter be reset for plea/sentencing
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court reminds Mr. Pape that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 2:50 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 4/12/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices
